Description: EA015 Community marriage or: Agamous communities without localized clans or any marked tendency toward either local exogamy or local endogamy

Description: EA015 Community marriage or: Demes, i.e., communities revealing a marked tendency toward local endogamy but not segmented into clan-barrios
Description: EA027 Kin terms for cousins: Descriptive or derivative, rather than elementary, terms employed for all cousins
Comment: EA027 Kin terms for cousins: But sibling terms are used for FaBrCh
Description: EA024 Cousin marriages perm: Quadrilateral marriage, i.e., marriage allowed with any first cousin

Description: EA015 Community marriage or: Segmented communities, i.e., those divided into barrios, wards, or hamlets, each of which is essentially a localized kin group, a clan or ramage, in the absence of any indication of local exogamy. Large extended families (see "Domestic organization"), are treated as clan-barrios if they are integrated by a rule of ambilineal, matrilineal, or patrilineal descent.
